comment.author: 54135313@N05
comment._content: Could these photographs be from the May 27, 1911 "Dreamland" fire?

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: More information from melthorntonkbny: twitter.com/#!/melthorntonbkny/status/89433219782549504 Periodic fires would also be the nemesis of Coney Island. However, they would change Coney Island's character and help modernize some of its seedier sections. The notorious Gut partially burned in 1883 and in 1892, a fire that started at Chamber's Drug Store, burned the West Brighton Hotel. During May 1894 the West End suffered $800,000 damage when burned. Then two years later the Elephant Hotel and the adjacent scenic railway, the Shaw Channel Chute, burned in a spectacular blaze that deprived Coney of a landmark. West Brighton endured another fire in 1899 and in 1903 the Bowery from Steeplechase's entrance to Feltman's was completely consumed in flames. Some felt that fire and brimstone was an appropriate end to the debauchery that occurred there, but owners surprised skeptics and rebuilt.
